title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.8 - Reissuance of an initial certificate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.8 - Reissuance of an initial certificate

State Regulations
(a) The holder of an initial certificate in
the classroom teaching service or in the title school counselor whose
certificate has expired may have such certificate reissued on up to two
occasions for a period of five years from the effective date of reissuance. (1)

For the first reissuance, the candidate
shall meet all requirements for the professional certificate in the certificate
title of such initial certificate except the education and/or experience
requirement. (2)

For the second
reissuance, the candidate shall meet all requirements for the professional
certificate in the certificate title of such initial certificate except the
education or experience requirement. (b) The holder of an initial certificate in
the title school building leader whose certificate has expired may have such
certificate reissued on up to two occasions for a period of five years from the
effective date of reissuance, provided that they meet all requirements for the
professional certificate in the title school building leader except the
experience requirement. (c) Notwithstanding subdivisions (a) or (b) of this section, candidates who were
issued one reissuance of an initial certificate and a time extension pursuant
to section
80-1.6
(a) and (b)
of this Title shall not receive a second reissuance of such initial
certificate. Candidates who were issued a time extension pursuant to section
80-1.6
(a) and (b)
of this Title shall receive a reissuance of such initial certificate on one
occasion only under the first reissuance requirements in paragraph (a)(1) of
this section. Candidates who were issued a reissuance of an initial certificate
on or after May 20, 2020 and prior to August 2, 2023 may receive a second
reissuance under the first reissuance requirements in paragraph (a)(1) of this
section. Notes
